DOC.brief_summary: Background : Positive pressure pneumoperitoneum ( PP ) may involve adverse pathophysiological change , include increase intra-thoracic ocular pressure , combine standard ventilation . High frequency jet ventilation ( HFJV ) report reduce adverse cardiovascular effect laparoscopic cholecystectomy . Aim : To study effect HFJV intra-ocular pressure change ( reflect intra-cranial pressure ) laparoscopic surgery PP .
DOC.detailed_description: Patients method : The investigator study 2 group patient electively schedule laparoscopic cholecystectomy . The study group include 10 patient ventilate high frequency jet ventilation ( HFJV ) . In control group ( 16 patient ) investigator use standard intermittent positive pressure ventilation ( IPPV ) . Both group match accord clinical hemodynamic parameter . Intra-ocular pressure measure senior ophthalmologist blind ventilation technique . Laparoscopic surgery do usual , intra-peritoneal pressure automatically set 14 mmHg . Statistical significance consider whenever P value less 0.05 . The investigator anticipate use HFJV laparoscopic operation PP may prevent increase intra-ocular pressure accompanies increase intra-abdominal pressure conventional ventilation ( IPPV ) .
